page.title: 10LOCAL ELECTIONS - 1985
page.content: On May 2nd 1985 the electorate went to the poll for new County Councillors.In the Burbage ward,three candidates from the Conservative, Labour and Alliance parties stood for election. The cost of and threat to the local services dominated the campaign, along with education and rates reform.Labour wished to prevent any further Conservative cuts,the Conservatives wanted to have better control of spending and the Alliance wanted all services managed more efficiently. The election was fought with the following results: { John Howard (Conservative) 1728 votes { Albert York (Alliance) 1138 votes { Raymond Linforth (Labour) 366 votes John Howard has represented Burbage since 1977.Councillor Howard is a Warranted Scouter and President of the Burbage Carnival Committee.
